Hello

I help run a beauty related site.  It is basically all about facial plastic surgery that helps regain self confidence and boosts self esteem. If there is a choice to be beautiful all the time, why not stay as beautiful as always.
 
Anyway, I am writing to you because I have recently viewed your site and am impressed with all of the helpful information.  Your site has the potential of reaching out to a wide range of people! I would like to request to have our site posted on your site, by way of paid contextual link advertisement. Let me know how much it would cost me to have my link placed on your main page, or other related internal pages.
 
I’d be delighted to receive a follow up from you. Please contact me at your earliest convenience so we can further discuss this interesting business opportunity.
 
Mila Gan
Site Link Manager

fields.personal_interests: I enjoy reading, teaching, scuba diving, writing, theatre, dancing, improvisation, good food and wine with my husband, and my cats.
fields.employment:
**Private Massage and Natural Health Practice, 2001-present**
SANTA BARBARA, CA (formerly in Los Angeles, CA 1995-1999)
	
Work with individuals (22-26/week) in a therapeutic setting for recovery from injuries/stress. Close work with local chiropractors for continuity of care. Use techniques including deep tissue, trigger point, prenatal techniques, and Reiki. Natural Health Consultations and Birth Assisting also available.  *Selected as a “Best Practice” by Massage Magazine for 2006 AND 2007*

**Santa Barbara Business College, Faculty, September 2007 – June 2008**
SANTA BARBARA, CA 
Instructor for *Pathology for Massage*, *Nutrition for Fitness* and *Introduction to Nutrition for Fitness Trainers*. 

**Massage Therapist/Chiropractic Assistant, 2001-2003**
DR’S CRAVIOTTO, DAWSON AND WAGNER, DC’s

Work closely with chiropractors on treatment of their patients.

**Selected by Massage Magazine as a “Best Practice” for 2006 and 2007**

**Selected for inclusion in Cambridge Who’s Who, 2010.**

Licensed for massage therapy in Santa Barbara County and Cities of Santa Barbara and Goleta.

Member of Associated Bodywork Massage Professionals, Clayton College Alumni Association, American 	Naturopath Medical Association, National Association of 	Women Business Owners, and Central Coast Doula Assoc.
fields.training_and_education:
March 2009 – present  **Clayton College of Natural Health.** Pursuing PhD in Natural Health. Mind/Body Medicine, Chinese Medicine, Ayurvedic Medicine, Five electives (TBD) and Dissertation. 

2009 **American Naturopath Medical Association Convention.** 26 hours of lecture on various topics such as Detoxification, Nutrition, Energy Medicine, Iridology, Chemically-induced Disease, Minerals, Acupressure, Anti-aging, Cancer Treatments, GMO’s, Preventing Healing Crisis, Emotional Auditing, Legal 

2007- January 2009  **Clayton College of Natural Health.**  M.S. in Natural Health. Highest Honors. Curriculum included Nutrition, Biology, Cancer Treatment, Anatomy, Holistic Development, Healing Relationships, Homeopathy for Animals, Psychospiritual Health, Herb/Vitamin/Mineral/RX interaction, Personal Environment, Mind/Body Wellness. Currently pursuing a Ph.D. in Natural Health.

2008 **Comprehensive Nutrition Training.** Crayhon Research. 16 hours of lecture
on latest nutritional breakthroughs, eating and supplements for disease, politics of food, autoimmune disorders, gastrointestinal health, weight loss.

2008 **American Naturopath Medical Association Convention.** 26 hours of lecture 
on various topics such as Nutrition for Stress, Fingernail and Tongue Analysis, Chronic Pain, Iridology, Food and Disease, Carpal Tunnel Syndrome (non-surgical treatments), Client Communication, Inflammation, Cancer Therapies, Skin disorders, Legal Concerns and CPR Certification with the American Heart Assoc. 

June 2008 **Food First Seminar with Crayhon Research.**    6 hour lecture on latest nutritional research and special diets for treating disease. 

March 2008  **Food First Seminar with Crayhon Research.**  6 hour lecture on latest nutritional research and health. 

2006-2007  **Clayton College of Natural Health.**  Doctor of Naturopathy for Health Care Professionals. Highest Honors. Curriculum included Herbology, Iridology, Homeopathy, Diet, Cleansing and Nutrition, Mind-body medicine, Practicum and Assessment techniques. 

2007  **Energetic Kinesiology and Muscle Testing.** 8 hours. Work with kinesiology to assess conditions and recommend natural remedies. 

2007  **American Naturopath Medical Association Convention.**   26 hours of lecture on various topics such as Cell Healing, Nutrition, Whole Foods, Minerals, Iridology, Detoxification, Children’s Nutrition, Natural Pain Relief, Hormones, Emotional Medicine, Heart Disease, and Color Healing. Special workshops in Probiotics, Energy Balancing, Pain Relief and Intestinal Disorders.

2007	  **Healing And the Childbearing Year.** Central Coast Doula Association Conference featuring Penny Simkin. Childhood Sexual Abuse and its effect on childbearing, Postpartum care, Infant care, Healing Remedies for the childbearing year. 

2007  **Dr’s Gaby and Wright Nutrition and Disease Lecture.**  4 day lecture addressing every vitamin, mineral, enzyme and amino acid and information on nutrition for over 300 diseases and disorders. 

2006	  **American Naturopath Medical Association Convention.**   26 hours of lecture on various topics such as Nutrition, Mind-body medicine, Herbs, Chinese Medicine, Breath work, Homeopathics, Cancer, Depression and Diabetes education. 

2006  **Clayton College of Natural Health.**  Certificate of Natural Wellness Highest Honors, Curriculum included Nutrition, Mind-Body Medicine, Alternative Practices, Holistic Lifestyles, and Energy Techniques.

2003  **Medical Massage Certification.** LMTSuccessGroup, 45 hour program with training in Postural Distortion, Back Conditions, Cervical Conditions, Arm and Leg Disorders, Insurance Billing and Healing with E-Stim. 

2001  **Training and Certification SB School of Massage.**  200 hour program with training in Swedish, Sports, Shiatsu, On-site Chair, Chiropractic Massage, Pregnancy, Myofascial Release, Deep Tissue, Polarity Balancing, Anatomy and Ethics and Business. 

1995  **Training and Certification School of Massage, Encino, CA.** 75 hour program with training in Swedish, Deep Tissue, Anatomy and Ethics.

**3 years Private Study with Pat Mauro, LMT, RN, EMT; Pittsburgh, PA.** Training in Deep Tissue, Body Manipulation, Herbs, and Intuitive Massage 

**1988-1992 Point Park University, Pittsburgh, PA.**  BFA theatre, Minor in Psychology, Cum Laude
	
**Reiki Certification to Master Level with Diane Vaughn RM, Venice, CA.**

I have taught group as well as individual classes and perform healings and attunements.

fields.text:
Kathy L. Gruver, MS, LMT, RM is a licensed and certified medical massage therapist, Reiki master, natural health consultant, birth assistant and traditional naturopath. Kathy has been involved in healing since 1990.

On this site you will find information about massage and natural health services as well as information about Kathy's writing, workshops and features as an expert.

fields.name: Massage
fields.description: Deep tissue, trigger point, swedish, sports massage and pregnancy massage.

fields.price:
$1/minute:
Please contact me for group/repeat rates.
fields.name: Onsite Chair Massage
fields.description: Onsite massage for your company, event or party.

fields.name: Romance Special Massage
fields.description: Two therapists, Two one-hour massages and a bottle of wine.

fields.name: Pregnancy Massage
fields.description: Massage tailored towards the comfort of a pregnant mother.

fields.name: Elder Massage
fields.description: Having worked with clients as old as 101, Kathy takes special care to assist the elderly with massage and energy work. Kathy has worked with clients with Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, Brain injuries, diabetes and stroke. Home and hospital visits are available on a limited basis.

fields.name: Natural Health Consulting
fields.description: Partnering with you to make gentle changes to achieve your health goals.

fields.name: Healthier Office
fields.description: In-office workshops to promote office health and wellness.

fields.price:
Reiki Healing $85
with attunement $135
group classes $65
fields.name: Reiki
fields.description: Hands on energy healing for body mind and spirit. (more...)

fields.name: Bach Flower Essences
fields.description: Consultation with first formula. (more...)

fields.name: Birth Assisting
fields.description: I feel my role as a birth assistant is to support the mother and her partner with massage, Reiki, aromatherapy, etc., and to make sure her birth plan is followed.

fields.name: Ear Coning
fields.description: Can help relieve vertigo, swimmer's ear and hearing loss.

fields.name: Massage Your Mate Classes
fields.description:
Learn to rub people the RIGHT way!™

I arrive with table and lotion and teach safe, effective, ways for you to massage your loved one.

fields.answer: I require 24 hours notice or you will be charged for the session.
fields.question: What is your cancellation policy?

fields.answer: You will be covered during your massage with the exception of the body part being worked on. Most people disrobe fully but you may leave your underwear on if you prefer. We require draping and do not do fully nude massage. During Reiki and Ear Coning, you stay fully clothed.
fields.question: What do I wear during my massage?

fields.answer: It is very important to drink water after your massage; it keeps the toxins from settling back into the muscles. Some light stretching, a hot bath with epsom salts and rest can also be beneficial post-session. Don't forget to make another appointment so you can continue your healing.
fields.question: What should I do after my massage?

fields.answer: Massage increases circulation, helps improve muscle tone, flushes toxins out of the body, moves lymph, and encourages relaxation which decreases blood pressure. It relieves stress in our bodies and improves overall health. There are certain conditions that contraindicate massage such as some skin disorders and certain types of cancer. Please discuss your concerns before your massage session. Fill out the intake form completely and be honest with your therapists about your health conditions.
fields.question: What are some of the benefits of massage?

fields.answer:
First off, we do not charge a monthly fee as some discount massage places do.

We hire only highly trained, experienced therapists.

We perform a full 60 or 90 minute massage whereas a lot of larger massage offices and spas take 10 minutes off for dressing and undressing time and still call it an hour massage.

You receive continuity of care at Healing Circle Massage, we do not have frequent turnover of therapists.
fields.question: How does Healing Circle Massage differ from some of these discount massage places I see popping up?

fields.answer: We will check in throughout the massage to make sure the pressure is deep enough or light enough for you. If at any point the pressure is wrong, the temperature in the room is uncomfortable or you need something, please ask. We're here to insure your massage is wonderful. Believe me, you won't hurt our feelings or make us feel bad by asking us to change something.
fields.question: My last massage therapist worked way too deep and hurt me, how do I know you won't do the same?

fields.answer:
Reiki is a hands on healing technique which channels Universal energy through the practitioner and into the person being healed. It goes to where it is needed and heals on all levels: Body, mind and spirit. The energy is sometimes felt as a heat or tingling in the hands.

Reiki can only be used for positive purposes and can be practiced anytime, anywhere simply by placing your hands on a person (or animal/plant) with the intention to heal. There are 3 levels of Reiki; I, II and Reiki Master, which I am, giving the ability to pass the attunements, i.e. give Reiki to others to use. The title Reiki Master simply means that you can pass attunements and teach others.

My Reiki healings consist of crystal and gemstone placement on the chakras and a full body session of energy work. An attunement may follow if the client is interested in continuing the healing on herself or others.
fields.question: What is Reiki?

fields.answer: Edward Bach discovered 38 flower essences that help balance out our emotional/spiritual personalities. By working with each client individually, a formula of these essences is customized to help achieve balance. Issues such as jealousy, anger, depression, excessive worry and anxiety can be addressed.
fields.question: What are Bach Flower Essences?

fields.answer: An ancient technique using a hollow paraffin or beeswax taper to draw impurities out of the ear. A non-invasive proceedure taking about 30 minutes, ear coning (or candling) has been known to help swimmer's ear, tinnitus, vertigo, hearing loss and eliminate excessive ear wax.
fields.question: What is Ear Coning?

fields.name: Client Appreciation 2003 In loving memory of Dorothy Boothe 11/15/2007
It's Time to Raise the Bar

fields.description: When I moved to the valley, I didn't even try to find a new therapist. I drive down to see Kathy.
What would I do without you?
There are so many massage therapists in town, but Kathy is so much more than just a massage person. I know my patients are going to get the best care possible.
The most grounded professional therapist I've ever met. And I've met a bunch.
That is the best money I've spent on myself in a long time.
Not just a massage therapist, truly a healer
I've had massage all over the world and you are the best!!
My hands were always going numb and after just one visit, my hands stopped tingling.
Kathy was able to give me some tips for helping my low back that worked. Why didn't my doctor tell me those things?
You have changed my life!
Responsible, kind, caring, a true angel on earth.
I felt this warmth in her hands and my heart became so full of love I almost wept.
The perfect combination of fabulous business woman and amazing healer.
It's so nice to have a care-giver.
I was a total skeptic that massage could do anything! I'm still not sure how it works, but I find myself encouraging people to go see Kathy. I don't know what you're doing, but I can sleep now.

You do awesome work.  I didn't even realize how much my head and neck were bothering me until now, about an hour after you finished working on me.  I have my vision and mental focus back already.  Can't wait to see you next week.
You actually brought tears to my eyes when I read your article out of sheer relief that someone else understands.  Thanks to you, I have made a commitment to turn my life-work balance around!
I just wanted you to know how great I think your writing skills are.  The article was not only inspiring, but completely honest, to the point, and truthful: an outstanding piece of writing.
Your writing style is perfect for talking to the student reader in a personal, accessible, yet professional and experienced manner.
Thank you for your thoughtful and "on target" info you have acquired over the years in the field.
I appreciate that you've taken the time to help educate others in our field and the general public as well.

I have to say that I was very glad to read this article.  I had some similar experiences during an appointment.  It was very informative and answered a lot of questions I had and wasn't sure how to ask.  Keep up the great articles.  I am in a place that I don't really have anyone to ask question so thank you for this article.
This was a very well written reminder of these protocols we already know, but may have either forgot or never learned.  Thanks for your contribution to our profession.

My husband was having a really bad headache and I remembered the technique that you showed in the DVD.  I tried it on him and his headache went away.  I was so touched that I could help him relieve his pain.  Thanks!

fields.source: Lesa Caputo, Brown and Brown Insurance
fields.description:
Thanks so much for the inspiring, educational and deeply thought provoking presentation you made this morning on Women’s Health in the Workplace.  As a constantly emotionally and physically depleted working mom with a very successful and highly stressful business that I juggle with the care giving of 3 small children under the age of 6 at home, there was so much that I took away from this morning that I literally cannot wait to get started!  I am motivated, I am committed and I have you to thank for the profound reminder of the vows I need to make to myself above all others that make their demands on me daily.
Bless you.
Super inspirational reminder of what we need to practice daily.  Please pass on my comments and compliments and gratitude to our speaker!

Kathy approaches her lectures with the ability to relate very well to her audience. Not only is she extremely knowledgeable about health issues, she has a great sense of humor which puts the audience at ease, and therefore more willing to hear and process her valuable information.
Kathy could even make pathology fun.
I wasn't sure what to expect but I learned a lot. Kathy made the lecture both fun and informative.

fields.source: Lisa Smith, Publisher at Big Blend Magazine
fields.description: Besides keeping our readers informed on natural health and alternative medicine with her popular monthly column in BigBlendMagazine.com, Kathy Gruver is an excellent radio guest who joins us frequently on Big Blend Radio’s ‘Ultimate Living’ quality of life radio show. She not only provides our listeners with the information they need when it comes to keeping their health in check, but she is well-spoken, entertaining, and professional in every sense of the word. After listening to her speak, you will find yourself motivated about being healthy and excited to take care of your body!

fields.source: Beverly Mineo, National Sales Manager Canary Hotel, Santa Barbara, CA
fields.description:
Recently I had the pleasure of hearing Kathy speak on the body and mind connection in achieving and maintaining good health. I found the presentation to be fascinating, educational and especially inspiring. She has a rare talent of including humor in motivating and inspiring your audience. I am involved with several groups that book speakers for seminars and other events and will be recommending Kathy to them. 
Thank you for such a powerful presentation, I immediately began replacing negative thoughts with positive ones!

fields.source: Michelle Profant,  President , Santa Barbara Northside Optimist Club
fields.description: On behalf of the Santa Barbara Northside Optimist Club, let me thank you again for speaking to our group. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed your talk on the mind/body connection and how we can all play a greater role in our wellness. Your ability to explain the sometimes complicated components of health including facts along with some humor is a rare quality. You did an excellent job in conveying the key elements that we all can benefit from knowing.

fields.source: Attendee at NAWBO SB, Wellness for the Working Woman lecture
fields.description: Great workshop! Lots of information I knew and lots that I didn’t. **Very** well presented!

fields.source: Dawn Hampton , President,  National Association of Women Business Owners, Santa Barbara
fields.description: Kathy Gruver has spoken to the National Association of Women Business Owner’s, Santa Barbara Chapter on *Wellness for the Working Woman: How to Take Back Your Health and Slow Down the Aging Process*. She entertains and educates and is a phenomenal speaker providing her audience with many ah-ha moments about their life and health.

fields.source: Cathy Feldman,  Program Co-Chair,  National Association of Women Business Owners, Santa Barbara
fields.description: Kathy Gruver's informative and fun workshop on Wellness and the Working Woman for NAWBO-SB was terrific.  Full of great advice on nutrition, balancing our lives as well as some easy exercises we can do throughout the day to keep us limber and well, it was a worthwhile and thoroughly professional presentation.  Thank you, Kathy.
